title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice
notes: Steam launch option "PROTON_USE_WINED3D11=1 %command%" required to run it. Usually the game crashes on the first splash screen with error message "fatal error". But sometimes you get past that and can get into the game, the audio is distorted and graphics are overall okay but some objects are invisible.

title: Ryse: Son of Rome
notes: It works out of the box, with a 40% hit, but it is fixable. Edit system.cfg in the game folder, adding "sys_highrestimer=1", and it works like native.

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX Vega (VEGA10, DRM 3.26.0, 4.18.0, LLVM 8.0.0)
notes: Installs and starts with no issues graphically. Needs "winetricks xaudio2_7=native" in order for audio to work.
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

notes:
It runs out of the box. Steam Controller and Xbox360 wireless controller work along with Big Picture Mode. But there are audio issues. The sound clips with a constant popping noise and the volume is off on most sound effects and voices. To fix this I used protontricks
My Steam download dir is not in the default location. To get protontricks running I had to install winetricks and wine, and then set my environment variables
STEAM_DIR to steam games director
PROTON_VERSION to '3.7 Beta'.
To fix the audio issue
protontricks 414340 xac
protontricks 414340 winecf
add library override for xaudio2_7 and set it to Nativ
This tweak alone causes the game to crash after the intro cutscene or loading a save. To fix the crash I added the Steam launch option
PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command
After all this, I played for like 45 minutes without issue. My system couldn't handle 'Very High' settings though
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

gpu: X.Org Radeon RX 580 Series (POLARIS10, DRM 3.23.0, 4.15.0-34-generic, LLVM 6.0.0)
notes: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-RCxBngC6N0
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

gpu: Intel Open Source Technology Center Mesa DRI Intel(R) UHD Graphics 620 (Kabylake GT2)
notes:
winetricks xact
PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 PULSE_LATENCY_MSEC=20 %command%
With esync enabled, runs out of fds on second and first run.
Need to fiddle with the mouse for pointer warping to work, otherwise you can't "turn" once your pointer hits the screen edge.
graphics: medium (except high textures), 1280x720 fullscreen, ~7 fps
Colours are somewhat off (everything has a lime tint) and graphics seem generally somewhat off. I didn't realize it until I saw someone else's screen, since some of the graphical glitches as part of Senua's backstory.
Audio/subtitle sync and stuttering seems to be fixed with xact.
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

notes: After using xact the game runs fine. Without xact the audio crackles a lot.  I was shocked it ran at all since my cpu isn't up to the requirements.
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

notes: Needs winetricks xact then winecfg library override for xaudio2_7. If you have esync crashes, and need PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 to run it, your open file limits are probably too low (happens on Fedora). The CORRECT solution is here. https://github.com/zfigura/wine/blob/esync/README.esync Increase the file limits and remove the PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 launch option.
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

notes: The game has two issues out of the box. The crackling sound and a crash after starting the gameplay (menus work fine). The first problem is solved with winecfg adding the library xaudio2_7. The crash is fixed by adding the Steam launch option: PROTON_NO_ESYNC=1 %command. After these fixes, the game runs with a good performance, no glitches or errors.
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice

notes:
Installed the game, just starts out of the box. Some crackling sound in the intro of the game. Joypad works (with vibration), Vsync is not applied (I can see tearing).
After using ALT-tab a few times, taking a screenshot and running the game in the background while writing this report the game crashes. While not using Alt-tab the game runs fine.

In the beginning of the game there are no frame drops, but later on there are, lower than 20fps on a Geforce GTX 1080.  Lowering the graphics detail doesn't make a difference, it seems to be caused by something else. Especially while moving, turning, looking around. When standing still everything seems to be fine. On Windows I can play the game on Ultra settings without frame drops.
Turning off esync, d3d11 or using wined3d11 instead does not fix this problem.

The graphics do not show any artifacts though.
title: Hellblade: Senua's Sacrifice
